Function Documentation

PIZGrowingArray* pizGrowingArrayNew ( long  size  ) 

Create the dynamic array.

Parameters:
size The size of memory allocated initially to the array. In case of failure the pointer is NULL.
Returns:
A pointer to the new dynamic array.
Remarks:
The following shows how to create a dynamic array. 
 PIZGrowingArray *array = NULL;

 array = pizGrowingArrayNew (16);  
 array = pizGrowingArrayNew (0);  // default value is 4.

Free the dynamic array.

It is safe to pass NULL pointer.

long  value 
)

Append a value to the array.

Parameters:
x A valid pointer.
value The value to append.
Returns:
An error code.

Parameters:
x A valid pointer.
index The index (zero-based).
value The value.
Warning:

Definition at line 92 of file pizGrowingArrayExtended.c.

PIZError pizGrowingArrayCopy ( PIZGrowingArray *  x,
const PIZGrowingArray *  toCopy 
)

Copy a dynamic array.

Parameters:
x A valid pointer.
toCopy A valid pointer to the dynamic array to be copied.
Returns:
An error code.
Remarks:
The new memory size reallocated is the memory size of the copied array in case of exceeding.

Definition at line 107 of file pizGrowingArrayExtended.c.

PIZError pizGrowingArrayAppendArray ( PIZGrowingArray *  x,
const PIZGrowingArray *  toAppend 
)

Append a dynamic array.

Parameters:
x A valid pointer.
toAppend A valid pointer to the dynamic array to be appended.
Returns:
An error code.
Remarks:
The new memory size reallocated is the sum of both memory sizes in case of exceeding.

Definition at line 135 of file pizGrowingArrayExtended.c.

PIZError pizGrowingArrayAppendPtr ( PIZGrowingArray *  x,
long  argc,
long *  argv 
)

Append a long array.

Parameters:
x A valid pointer.
argc The number of values to append.
argv The pointer to the values to append.
Remarks:
The new memory size is set according to a geometric progression of ratio 2.
